intro: Meibomia illinoensis, commonly known as the Illinois meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Meibomia illinoensis produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
